River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowdfounding climax is overwrought and incredibly distasteful: attempting to draw parallels between the Nazi Holocaust and the persecution of the Maori to gain some odd sort of equal rights by training a likable, but fanatical military leader who leads his people into massacre.

I was hoping for a treat to watch, but I think it was pretty much boring. If any, I would recommend reading the book first.
